title: The average (arithmetic mean) of 5,10,15 and x is 20. What is the value of x? - Quora

response.answer_text: 50. 20–15=5 20–10=10 20–5=15 which makes sum of these three 30 less than it would have been if all the values were 20. so x will be 30 more to make the average of these 20. 30+20=50 so x is 50. you needn't do all these calculations for this you'll get this at a glance. This is just the explanation.

Mathematically stated, your question is equivalent to solving [math]\dfrac{5 + 10 + 15 + x}{4} = 20[/math]. Now multiply both sides of the equation by [math]4[/math] and subtract [math]5, 10[/math] and [math]15[/math] to get [math]x = 50[/math].
